TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the city of ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a family consisting of husband and wife , ORG and PERSON , respectively , and GPE , the daughter of GPE , was granted the tenancy of a publicly - owned apartment . In DATE ORG and GPE divorced .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE GPE and GPE instituted civil proceedings in ORG of Kharkiv ( “ the ORG ” ) against ORG , seeking to declare that the latter was no longer entitled to live in the apartment in question . ORG , in turn , lodged a counterclaim , seeking to have his property right over the disputed apartment acknowledged .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court allowed the claim of GPE and GPE
CARDINAL . In DATE , following privatisation procedures , a “ property certificate ” ( приватизаційний сертифікат ) was issued to GPE and GPE for the apartment .

CARDINAL . NORP However , on DATE , following an application for supervisory review ( protest ) , ORG ( after DATE ORG ; “ the ORG ” ) set aside the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE and GPE sold the apartment to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE or DATE , ORG lodged additional claims , seeking to have the apartment ’s sales contract declared null and void and to have the applicant evicted . According to a copy of the court records provided by the applicant , he has been participating in the proceedings as a third party since DATE . On DATE ORG attached the disputed apartment . Subsequently , on a number of occasions , the applicant requested the court to lift its attachment but this was to no avail .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a counterclaim against ORG , seeking a declaration that the contract was valid and that he was a bona fide purchaser . On DATE ORG ruled to consider this claim at the same time as other claims lodged by ORG

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the claims of ORG and the applicant , and dismissed the claims of ORG In particular , it found that ORG was no longer entitled to live at the disputed apartment , declared the sales contract valid and acknowledged that the applicant was a bona fide purchaser . ORG appealed .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the courts examined the admissibility of ORG ’s appeal . On DATE ORG extended the time - limit during which the parties could lodge an appeal against the judgment of DATE . According to the applicant , the courts did not inform him about the hearings on the appeal and the decisions were not delivered to him in good time .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for fresh consideration . On DATE ORG , sitting as a court of cassation , dismissed the appeals in cassation of ORG and the applicant , and upheld the decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG took over the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged a request to transmit the case to another court . On DATE ORG allowed his request . On DATE ORG quashed the ruling of DATE .
